DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection Plasma Aliquot Volume Milliliter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The volume of plasma contained in the aliquot measured in milliliters.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act or process of gathering biospecimens for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes._Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation._Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The act or process of gathering biospecimens for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes.

Concepts.definition: The act or process of gathering biospecimens for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes.

Property.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.:Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.:The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.:A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
